description.narrative: The development objective of the Road Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project will be to assist Bulgaria to reduce road transport costs by improving the condition and quality of its roads network during the first years of European Union (EU) accession. The major modifications being are: (i) changes to project components by expanding the scope of 'component two: institutional development' and focusing it on the absorption of EU funds, and reducing the scope of 'component one: rehabilitation of selected roads' to reflect the reduced budget for the project which impacts the project's financing plan; (ii) extending the loan closing date by 24 months to enable full completion of the expanded component two and of all ongoing road rehabilitation works under component one; (iii) reallocation of loan proceeds between disbursement categories to reflect the changes to project components, and increase the percentage of expenditures to be financed from loan proceeds; and (iv) modifications of outcome and impact indicators to reflect the changes.

title.narrative: Updating of road data for Class III roads (% of total length per year)

comment.narrative: The figure as of May 2013 is 2%. Due to insufficient budget road data is collected only for rehabilitated road sections.

title.narrative: Updating of road data for Class I roads (% of total length per year)

comment.narrative: The figure as of May 2013 is 20%.

title.narrative: Updating of road data for Class II roads (% of total length per year)

comment.narrative: The figure as of May 2013 is 4%. Due to insufficient budget road data is collected only for rehabilitated road sections.

title.narrative: Works (W), Goods (G), and Consulting Services (CS) contracts processed and managed by Management Consultant
Number of kilometers of Class I roads rehabilitated under the Project
Number of kilometers of Class II roads rehabilitated under the Project
Number of kilometers of Class III roads rehabilitated under the Project
Consultant services for project management support for operational programs provided

comment.narrative: Services are being provided by Jaspers.

title.narrative: Consultant and advisory services for road sector management

comment.narrative: The number of staff-months will be 18 by the project closing date - June 30, 2012.

title.narrative: Training received by RIA staff from management Consultant (in staff-hours)
Percentage of improved Class III roads initially in poor condition, measured in IRI (International Road Roughness Index) - cumulative values
Capacity of RIA to manage road maintenance: number of area-wide maintenance contracts prepared
Percentage of improved Class II roads initially in poor condition, measured in IRI (International Road Roughness Index) - cumulative values
Percentage of improved Class I roads initially in poor condition, measured in IRI (International Road Roughness Index) - cumulativevalues
Vehicle Operating Cost on roads to be rehabilitated under the Project (Average, 2005 EUR per vehicle-kilometer)
Road safety strategy and plans prepared

comment.narrative: The Road Safety Action Plan has been updated recently under the Roads RAS. It includes an action plan for 2014 - 2020 and itsimplementation is expected to start after the approval by RIA's management board.

title.narrative: Project management manuals reviewed, finalized and in use

comment.narrative: This has been done with RIA's own funds.

title.narrative: Implementation and Effective use of Road Management System by RIA
Rolling Multi-year road maintenance and rehabilitation program established
Studies on institutional set up, human resources and development of competencies in the sector carried out
